com.jaap.antitowerdefence.antiTowerDefence

Class AntiTowerDefenceGUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jaap.antitowerdefence.antiTowerDefence.AntiTowerDefenceGUI

  • public class AntiTowerDefenceGUI
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is responsible for the graphics elements of a game, including the background, foreground, menu and other frames etc.
    Author:
    Joakim Sandman (tm08jsn)

      • AntiTowerDefenceGUI

        public AntiTowerDefenceGUI(java.awt.Image[] images,
                           int fps,
                           int width,
                           int height)
        Initializes a new AntiTowerDefenceGUI, including the main frame with menu and game panels.
        Parameters:
        images - The images to draw.
        fps - The update speed of the foreground in frames per second.
        width - Width of the gamePanel (in tiles).
        height - Height of the gamePanel (in tiles).

      • newLevelGUI

        public void newLevelGUI(Terrain[] grass,
                        java.util.concurrent.CopyOnWriteArrayList<Terrain> road,
                        java.util.concurrent.CopyOnWriteArrayList<Unit> units,
                        java.util.concurrent.CopyOnWriteArrayList<Tower> towers,
                        LevelStats stats)
        Initializes the background and foreground components with the necessary data to draw a new level.
        Parameters:
        grass - Grass array to draw.
        road - Road array to draw.
        units - Unit array to draw.
        towers - Tower array to draw.
        stats - Stats for current level.

      • isPaused

        public boolean isPaused()
        Finds whether the GUI is paused or not.
        Returns:
        TRUE if the cover is visible (GUI paused), otherwise FALSE.

        Parameters:
        text - Text to display.

      • showLosePanel

        public void showLosePanel(java.lang.String text)

        Parameters:

        text - Text to display.
